author: Hadlee Simons
title: Apple publishes first Android app
text:
Are you covered? Compare quotes for car, life and business insurance right now! 
Sign up for your free fax number and get faxes sent to your inbox! Apple publishes first Android app Article By: Hadlee Simons Thu, 17 Sep 2015 4:54 PM Share The iPhone 6. 
After several long years, Apple has published its first app on Google's Android platform. 
Don't get your hopes up though, because it's simply used to transfer your data to an iPhone. 
Yes, the app, named Move to iOS, moves your photos, videos, music, content and messages from Android to your Apple device. 
"When you choose to migrate your data, your new iPhone or iPad will create a private Wi-Fi network and find your nearby Android device running Move to iOS," read an excerpt of the Google Play Store description. 
"After you enter a security code, it will begin transferring your content and put it in the right places. Just like that. Once your content has been transferred, you're ready to get going. iOS will also set up your default mail account." 
Interestingly enough, it won't be the only Apple app that comes to Google's platform. 
The Cupertino company also plans to bring Apple Music to Android, marking a shift from Apple's strategy of only targeting iOS (and occasionally PC) users for its services. Read More
